channel.title: Dane Hager's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Dane Hager's Blog

item.title: About
item.description: My Name is Dane Hager. My educational background is in mathematical economics and statistics, and my working career has revolved around business process efficiencies, and business intelligence, reporting and analytics. In 2017, I started learning data science, mainly utilizing R, to gather knowledge to provide further insights and answers.

item.title: Analyzing Canada and the US for Life Expectancy
item.description: In working through the HarvardX Data Science program, we studied the gapminder data set to look at life expectancy rates across countries. In this example, we want to specifically look at two select countries within the data set - United States and Canada - to determine the life expectancy trajectory for both countries, and visualize any differences. To start, we need to enable the tidyverse and the dslabs packages library(tidyverse) ## Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 3.
